snippet: The effort to suppress news of a deadly Ferrari crash, insiders  now reveal, hastened the decline of the departing president, Hu Jintao, and spurred the ascent of China’s new leader, Xi Jinping.
abstract: Chinese Communist Party insiders reveal effort to suppress news of a car crash, following a night of partying, that took the life of Ling Gu, son of Ling Jihua, high-powered aide to China's president; crash and botched efforts at a cover-up hastened the decline of Hu Jintao, China's departing president, and spurred the ascent of new leader Xi Jinping; case illustrates how profligate lifestyles of leaders' relatives and friends have weighed heavily in China's backstage power tussles.

byline.contributor: Ian Johnson and Edward Wong contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The effort to suppress news of a deadly Ferrari crash, insiders  now reveal, hastened the decline of the departing president, Hu Jintao, and spurred the ascent of China’s new leader, Xi Jinping.

headline.seo: How Crash Cover-Up Altered China’s Succession
headline.main: How Crash Cover-Up Altered China’s Succession
headline.print_headline: How Crash Cover-Up Altered China’s Succession
